page.title: 16Community Centre
page.content: The County Council has converted a disused school to a youth and community centre. It's management committee is made up of local people and meets regularly. The centre is used daily by various organised groups and rooms can be hired. It is the meeting point for the under five year olds' play group, other groups arranged according to age including pensioners. There are nineteen organisations using the centre on a regular basis. Others include sports groups, mentally handicapped, Townswomens Guild and a room is used for unemployed young people to meet others similarly placed and to seek advice as needed from staff in attendance. Some groups meet for recreational purposes such as dancing and others for study of chosen subjects such as local history.
